VLIB_ORB_computeRBrief

Detailed Description


Functions

uint32_t VLIB_ORB_computeRBrief (const uint32_t intgrlImg[restrict], uint16_t intgrlImgPitch, uint16_t imgWidth, uint16_t imgHeight, const uint32_t featuresLoc[restrict], const uint8_t featuresWedge[restrict], uint32_t numFeatures, const int32_t relativePattern[restrict], uint8_t outFeatureDesc[restrict])

Function Documentation

uint32_t VLIB_ORB_computeRBrief ( const uint32_t  intgrlImg[restrict],
uint16_t  intgrlImgPitch,
uint16_t  imgWidth,
uint16_t  imgHeight,
const uint32_t  featuresLoc[restrict],
const uint8_t  featuresWedge[restrict],
uint32_t  numFeatures,
const int32_t  relativePattern[restrict],
uint8_t  outFeatureDesc[restrict] 
)

Description:
Computes the brief descriptor for each feature. This function can be called after the fast corners are detected. Additionally, since this function requires angles to be defined for each feature, VLIB_ORB_computeOrientation should have been run. Finally, this function requires that an integral image is available in the intgrlImg pointer.
Parameters:
[in] *intgrlImg Integral image of the input image
[in] *intgrlImgPitch Pitch of the integral image in pixels
[in] imgWidth Width of the image in pixels
[in] imgHeight Height of the image in pixels
[in] *featuresLoc Location of feature points in 32 bit packed form. lower 16 bit has to be x co ordinate
[in] *featuresWedge Angle bin for each feature point
[in] numFeatures Total number of feature points
[in] *relativePattern Top left byte offset for each pattern location from center location. One word for one offset
[out] *outFeatureDesc output pointer where output descriptor (of 256 bits) for each feature point
Assumptions:
  • intgrlImg buffer should be word aligned.
  • relativePattern should be double word aligned
  • One of the following FAST corner detectors is run prior to this function:
    • VLIB_afast9_detectCorners
    • VLIB_originalfast9_detectCorners
    • VLIB_afast12_detectCorners
    • VLIB_originalfast12_detectCorners
  • VLIB_ORB_computeOrientation should be run before running this function.
  • VLIB_integralImage8 should be run before running this function.
  • The list of features passed to this function should NOT be within the border area of the image (w/in 16 pixels * 1.42 of the edge of the image) since this function uses an orientation independent 32x32 patch size around the feature to compute descriptor
  • Angle of each feature point has to found , and then that has to be binned outside the kernel, and should be passed through featuresWedge
  • size of the relativePattern buffer is 30 ( total angle bins) * 256 ( 256 point set) * 2 (2 sets of points) * 4 (sizeof(int))
Implementation Notes:
  • This code is compatible with C6XXX fixed point processors.
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
